intro: Eriodictyon trichocalyx, commonly known as the California yerba santa, is a shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its gray-green, aromatic leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is known for its medicinal properties. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in chaparral and coastal sage scrub ecosystems. Its leaves contain compounds that have been used traditionally for their antiseptic and anti-inflammatory effects.
